sentence: Small amounts of ROS are necessary for body cell homeostasis and redox signaling (Fig. 1).
Thus, the greater the OS-mediated damage, the worse the risk of developing brain cancers becomes (Fig. 1).
These biomarkers have been illustrated in Fig. 2.

Emerging evidence shows that free radicals regulate many cellular events that endorse oncogenesis by boosting initiation, proliferation, angiogenesis, invasion, and cell arrest, as illustrated in Fig. 3 [26].
High concentration of vitamin C has shown the potential to kill different cancer cells including GBM cells selectively without affecting normal cells in vitro (Fig. 4) [78, 79].

Emerging evidence revealed that vitamin C at pharmacological doses potentiates the formation of O2•− and H2O2 that disrupt intrinsic iron metabolism and selectively sensitize GBM cells to chemotherapy (Fig. 4) [78].
Resveratrol regulates several signal transduction pathways to exhibit chemopreventive and chemotherapeutic effects in the management of brain cancers (Fig. 5).

More preclinical mechanistic studies are required to solve this puzzle.Effect of antioxidants on metabolic reprogramming
Numerous metabolic changes have been found in brain cancer cells or cancer-initiating cells that ensure proper energy supply to endorse proliferation and invasion (Fig. 6).
Small amounts of ROS are necessary for body cell homeostasis and redox signaling (Fig. 1).
Thus, the greater the OS-mediated damage, the worse the risk of developing brain cancers becomes (Fig. 1).
These biomarkers have been illustrated in Fig. 2.
